COPY
August 22, 1962
Dr. John Schwarzwalder
KTCA-TV
Twin City Area ETV Corporation
16^0 Como Avenue
St. Paul 13, Minnesota
Dear John:
I have your letter of August 17th and a copy of your letter to
Bill Harley of the same date. May I state again that, as here¬
tofore, I am heartily in sympathy with your ambitions and hopes for
a strong and independent NAEB organization. Furthermore, I am
equally as concerned over our state of solvency. Because of
these common, mutual attitudes on our part, I feel that we are
more responsible and have greater obligations to NAEB than some
who have not sensed the serious conditions I mention. I am con¬
vinced that we can slog through these times if we are sufficiently
dedicated, determined and patient. I accepted the chairmanship
of the NAEB TV Board with your blessing and have tried conscien¬
tiously to dispatch my responsibility in that office. I must
have your support if we are to make haste ever so slowly. In this
connection I mailed to you yesterday a proposal for structural
change that in my opinion will broaden the base of NAEB and more
effectively democratize its operation. If you approve of this
projected plan, I will most certainly need your assistance in
having it accepted and expedited.
I hope that you believe that I am seriously endeavoring to streng¬
then our professional organization in every possible way I know.
I am herein requesting personally and as a fellow broadcaster
that you assist me in what I know to be honest efforts toward
growth and development of our great organization. Please let me
hear from you at your earliest convenience.
With kindest personal regards, I am
Sincerely yours,
RDH/1t
Raymond D. Hurlbert
General Manager
